results.content: Overall, a comprehensive course with loads of areas covered. The course is clearly targeted to 'create an ecommerce app', so the focus is mainly on the practical applicability of the Jamstack. If you intend to build an ecommerce site, this fits perfectly. The instructor is engaging, but sometimes a bit to enthusiastic about certain pieces of soft (like the app design which 'fits perfectly to users' or the easiness of a centralized file for theme in React), even though there are similar alternatives and sometimes better ones in other approaches. He tries hard to sell every choice of software that he comes with, which leads to the feeling of him not being very experienced and particularly aware of other alternatives, but that's fine, all the technologies used are trendy and the theoretical aspects are not neglected. Course is above average regarding the mixture and quantity of tech/areas covered (while targeting ecommerce app) and is definitely a buy as a practical applicability of the Jamstack using some of the latest technologies.

response.content: Thank you very much, Danila, for the excellent feedback! I will certainly take this into consideration when working on my future courses.
response.content_html: Thank you very much, Danila, for the excellent feedback! I will certainly take this into consideration when working on my future courses.

results.content: Great concept and Good course so far. I'm giving it 3 stars because if you're familiar w/ react hooks and context api you're going to have many 'why?' moments. As in, why is there so much prop drilling? Or, why aren't we using useEffect for this? I got about 1/2 through before I decided to refactor my code, but I have 0 regrets because I think this course is a great reference for building an online store.

response.content: Hi Rob, thanks for the thorough and honest feedback. It really helps me improve my teaching style with constructive feedback like this. I think your criticism of some 'why' moments is totally valid. I think the reason for this is that I didn't want to overload the user with tons of brand-new information and advanced features right off the bat. This helps ease newer students into the information, but, as you've described, may seem tedious to those with more experience. We introduce and use those more advanced features throughout the course so maybe as you continue consider updating your review. Thank you very much!
response.content_html: Hi Rob, thanks for the thorough and honest feedback. It really helps me improve my teaching style with constructive feedback like this.
